result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Logan R Novak

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 2, 2022 at 11:30 am.

11:00 AM Defendant Logan R Novak in court.  Attorney Emily Nolan-Plutchak in court for Logan R Novak.  Attorney Jennifer C Zima in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Officer Berger is sworn in and testifies. Testifies to being a Patrol Officer for the City of Wisconsin Rapids. Testifies to conducting a traffic stop of a gold Chevy Blazer. Testifies to following the vehicle trying to read the license plate and could see the driver didn't have his seat belt on. Testifies to the vehicle going under the speed limit, which is found to be odd. Testifies to the driver being Logan Novak and the passenger was Aquanisha Grinnage. Witness identifies the defendants in court, court recognizes. Testifies to seeing Logan not having a seat belt on. Testifies to Logan having a suspended drivers license. Testifies to asking Sergeant Fleisner and his K-9 Unit to the scene and they arrived about 10 minutes later. Testifies to the K-9 alerting to the vehicle. Testifies to a search being conducted and what was found. 
Attorney Nolan-Plutchak cross examines the witness. Testifies to having body cam and squad cam footage. 
Attorney Kryshak cross examines the witness. Testifies to how long he was following the vehicle for. 
Sergeant Fleisner is sworn in and testifies. Testifies to being a Sergeant with the Wisconsin Rapids Police Department. Testifies to being apart of this traffic stop w/ Officer Berger. 
Attorney Emily Nolan-Plutchak cross examines the witness. Witness testifies to not always being called on scene. Testifies to not being sure if he had footage or not. 

Attorney Nolan-Plutchak and Attorney Kryshak bring up they haven't received the two videos from discovery.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion to Suppress Evidence
Final pre-trial on June 28, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Text Message Reminder of Court Date Agreement
Final pre-trial on April 14, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

01:17 PM Defendant Logan R Novak in court with attorney Emily M Nolan-Plutchak.  Jennifer C Zima appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waives the preliminary hearing. Not guilty pleas are entered. Bond is continued.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on February 2, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
